title: John Andrew (rugby league)
text:
John 'Straw' Andrew was a <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer in Australia’s major competition, the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League">New South Wales Rugby League</a> (NSWRL), during the early 1960s.
Career.
Andrew played for the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a> club, playing 38 matches across three seasons from 1960 to 1962. A <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions">fullback</a>, 'Straw' was a member of the <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Easts</a> side that went down to <a href="St%20George%20Dragons">St George</a> in the 1960 NSWRL Grand Final. Andrew had to be stretchered from the field in that match after suffering a broken leg.
In 1962, the <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions">fullback</a> experienced an even more severe injury when he broke his neck after being upended and driven head first into the ground in a <a href="spear%20tackle">spear tackle</a>.
He retired from rugby league soon after.
